plot: A research team from an electronics company move into an old Victorian house to start work on finding a new recording medium. When team member Jill Greeley witnesses a ghost, team director Peter Brock decides not only to analyse the apparition, which he believes is a psychic impression trapped in a stone wall (dubbed a "stone tape"), but to exorcise it too - with terrifying results...

f.role: Hysterical Woman: Jill's warnings that 'erasing' the stone tape has only uncovered something else are dismissed by all concerned, even Roy.

Played for horror in The Stone Tape where the scream of a housemaid killed back in the 1890's has become a Living Memory imprinted in the foundations of a castle. Later on a female colleague is killed by whatever lurks there, and it's her scream that's now imprinted in the building.
Screaming Woman: Played for horror. Jill's dying scream ends up being imprinted on the stone tape.
Sexy Secretary: One turns up with Crawford, and Brock doesn’t take long to bed her.

The ghost in The Stone Tape as she's dressed as a maid from the 19th century which gives one character fleeing the ghost gets a nasty shock when he runs into a female character dressed in her Labcoat of Science and Medicine.
Woman in White: Louisa Hanks, as she's dressed as an undermaid from the 19th century. This gives Alan a shock when he flees the room, but runs into Jill in her lab coat.

name: The Stone Tape
